# set(_:forKey:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the value of the specified key to an integer.

## Declaration

```swift
func set(_ value: Int, forKey defaultName: String)
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The integer value to store in the defaults database.
- **defaultName**: The key that contains the settingâ€™s name.

## Discussion

This method places the integer value in an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] type before writing the key and value to the defaults database. After you call this method, the system generates a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UserDefaults/didChangeNotification] for registered observers.

## Setting the value for a key

- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a Boolean value.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a floating-point number.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a double.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a URL.
- **set(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value of the specified key to a property list object.
